Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.example.miniproyecto3.controller.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
Controller class for managing the core gameplay logic and visual components of the Battleship game. This class is responsible for: - Initializing boards and ships for both player and AI. - Handling GUI events via FXML. - Managing turn-taking logic. - Handling AI difficulty and ship placement. - Tracking game state for serialization and continuation. - Coordinating music playback.
Since:
version 1.0
Version:
3.2
Author:
David Taborda Montenegro and Juan Pablo Piedrahita Triana.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the game controller. It sets up the UI components, initializes resources such as images and music, and handles logic for starting a new game or continuing a saved one. It distinguishes between a new game and a resumed game using the 'continueGame' flag, and performs corresponding setup actions such as enabling or disabling controls, loading images, creating boards, and setting up the ship selector. If an image file cannot be loaded, it manages an IOException. If a problem occurs when loading a saved game, it manages a VisualException.
      See Also:
      • VisualException

    • getStackPaneAt

      public javafx.scene.layout.StackPane getStackPaneAt(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane board, int row, int col)
      Retrieves the StackPane at the specified logical board coordinates (row, col).
      Parameters:
      board - The GridPane board.
      row - The row index of the desired cell.
      col - The column index of the desired cell.
      Returns:
      The StackPane at the specified coordinates, or null if not found.

    • getShipAt

      public Ship getShipAt(List<Ship> ships, int row, int col)
      Retrieves the ship occupying the given coordinates, if any.
      Parameters:
      ships - The list of ships to search.
      row - The row coordinate.
      col - The column coordinate.
      Returns:
      The Ship that occupies the given coordinates, or null if none found.
      See Also:
      • Ship

    • checkWinCondition

      public void checkWinCondition()
      Checks whether the game has reached a win condition (either player or machine wins). If the condition is met, displays the corresponding alert, stops the music, deletes the saved game file, and exits the application.
      See Also:
      • UIVisualHelper

    • debugBoards

      public void debugBoards()
      Prints a debug representation of both the player and machine boards to the console, including ship positions, hits, and sunk ship status.

    • saveGameState

      public void saveGameState()
      Saves the current state of the game to a serialized file. The game state includes both boards, ships, and machine AI.

    • loadGameState

      public void loadGameState() throws IOException
      Loads the game state from a previously saved serialized file. Updates both logical and graphical representations of the game.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error during file reading or UI board creation.

    • drawShot

      public void drawShot(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, boolean isHit, boolean isSunk)
      Draws a visual representation of a shot on the canvas. The image displayed depends on whether the shot was a hit, a sunk ship, or a miss.
      Parameters:
      gc - The GraphicsContext used to draw the image.
      isHit - True if the shot hit a ship.
      isSunk - True if the shot sunk a ship.

    • drawSunkShips

      public void drawSunkShips(Ship ship, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane board)
      Draws visual indicators for all coordinates of a sunk ship on the game board. Replaces previous "hit" markers with special visuals indicating that the ship has been destroyed.
      Parameters:
      ship - The Ship object that has been sunk.
      board - The GridPane on which the ship is drawn (either player's or machine's board).
